meanings.definition: Infection caused by the Candida fungus, typically affecting the skin or mucous membranes.
meanings.sent1: Candidiasis can cause redness and irritation on the skin.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often prescribe antifungal creams to treat candidiasis on the skin.
meanings.sent3: The candidiasis on the skin seemed to have a party of its own!
meanings.sent4: Her skin felt like a battleground, with candidiasis invading every corner.
meanings.sent5: The image of candidiasis spreading like wildfire on the skin was unsettling.

meanings.definition: A condition characterized by the overgrowth of Candida yeast in the body, often resulting in symptoms such as itching and discharge.
meanings.sent1: When candidiasis occurs internally, it can lead to discomfort in various parts of the body.
meanings.sent2: People with weakened immune systems are more prone to developing candidiasis.
meanings.sent3: The candidiasis in his body seemed to have a mind of its own, causing mischief.
meanings.sent4: Her body felt like a battleground, with candidiasis overpowering the good bacteria.
meanings.sent5: The thought of candidiasis multiplying inside her body was alarming.
